definitions: A large tree which bears acorns and typically has lobed deciduous leaves. Oaks are dominant in many north temperate forests and are an important source of durable timber used in building, furniture, and (formerly) ships.
A smoky flavour or nose characteristic of wine aged in barrels made from oak wood.
Used in names of other trees or plants that resemble the oaks in some way, e.g. she-oak, silky oak.
An annual flat horse race for three-year-old fillies run on Epsom Downs, over the same course as the Derby. It was first run in 1779.
A flat horse race similar to the Oaks but run on another course.
